gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Locations of Operation for Active Industrial Minerals Producers: Indiana, 2010

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: INDUSTRIAL_MINERALS_ACTIVE_2010_IN.SHP is a point shapefile that shows the locations of operation for industrial minerals producers that were active in 2010 in Indiana. These operations extract and (or) produce the following commodities: cement, clay and shale, crushed stone, dimension limestone, dimension sandstone, gypsum, lime, peat, and sand and gravel.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: INDUSTRIAL_MINERALS_ACTIVE_2010_IN.SHP was created to provide information about active industrial minerals producers in 2010 in Indiana, that suitable for use in a GIS.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This data set was compiled by Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability to a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the design or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS 10.2 shapefile format, approximately 1.99 Mb

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: This shapefile represents more than 90 percent of industrial mineral operations that were active in Indiana in 2010. Some operations may have been omitted that were not subject to federal or state regulation because of their relatively small size and (or) because of their lack of adverse effects on the environment.

The data contained in this shapefile was extracted from a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named "IMDIR10.xls" produced by the Indiana Geological Survey in 2011. The data from the spreadsheet is assumed to be complete and accurate.

The data contained in this shapefile were collected using a Trimble GeoExplorer III GPS receiver and was differentially corrected using the Indiana Geological Survey's base station data. Trimble states that no more than (plus/minus) 1 to 5 feet of error when GPS data is differentially corrected.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of these data.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: During the summer of 2001, staff of the Mineral Resources Section of the Indiana Geological Survey conducted field work to collect mine location data using a Trimble GeoExplorer III GPS unit. These data were downloaded to Trimble Pathfinder Office for processing and exported as an ESRI ArcView shapefile. The theme attribute table was converted to a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named "ACTIVEMINES2001.XLS." Company and commodity data from the 2001 Directory of Industrial Mineral Producers in Indiana were directly entered into that spreadsheet.

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: Active industrial minerals operation in study area.XLS

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The Microsoft Excel spreadsheet ACTIVEMINES2001.XLS was saved as a dBase III file named "ACTIVEMINES2001.DBF." The file ACTIVEMINES2001.DBF was added to an ESRI ArcView project as a table. The "Add Event Theme" and "Convert to Shapefile" functions were used to import the table into an ArcView View and to convert the table to a shapefile INDUSTRIAL_MINDERALS_ACTIVE_2001_IN. The shapefile INDUSTRIAL_MINDERALS_ACTIVE_2001_IN was then edited in ESRI ArcView. Of the 363 records in ACTIVEMINES2001.XLS there were 320 records that had complete locational information in the form of UTMx and UTMy coordinates. Records without such locational information were deleted from the shapefile. Of the 320 records with complete locational information, there were 314 records that had complete information regarding the name of the mine, pit, quarry, plant, and (or) company. Points lacking such information were deleted from the shapefile. Additional editing of the shapefile INDUSTRIAL_MINDERALS_ACTIVE_2001_IN was then conducted. The following fields were added: Commodity1, Commodity2, and Commodity3. Using the "Calculator" function, values in the field named "Commodity1" were set equal to values in the field named "Type." Records having no locational information but that had company information were used to fill in the fields Commodity2 and Commodity3. Finally, the following fields were then removed from the shapefile: Type, Quadrangle, Qtr, Sec, T, R, County_nam, Longitude, Latitude, and Number.

The Microsoft Excel spreadsheet "IMDIR10.XLS" was saved as a comma-delimited text file named "IMDIR10.TXT." IMDIR10.TXT was then added to an Esri ArcMap document, and the "Display XY Data" function was used to display the data using the UTM Zone 16, NAD 1983 latitude and longitude values contained in the original database. The layer named "LANDSURVEY_STATE_BOUNDARY_IN.SHP" was also loaded into ArcMap to ensure that all points generated from the X-Y coordinates were located within the geographic region of Indiana. The "Data > Export Data" function was then used to produce an Esri point shapefile named "INDUSTRIAL_MINDERALS_ACTIVE_2001_IN.SHP" to conform to the file-naming conventions of the IGS. Finally, the following fields were then removed from the attribute table of the shapefile: "Record_ID," "Quadrangle," "Sec_Twp," "County," and "Map_ID_Num."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit) and MP (Metadata Parser) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
Locations of operation for producers of industrial minerals in Indiana, 2010. Data include types of materials produced and information such as mine name, address, contact information, etc.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: IMDIR10.XLS: Directory of Active Industrial Mineral Sites in 2010 in Indiana (Microsoft Excel Spreadsheet)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
